definition[0]: a small steep waterfall that is one of several together
definition[1]: something that hangs down in large quantities
example[0]: Her hair fell over her shoulders in a cascade of curls.
definition[2]: to flow, fall, or hang down in large quantities
example[1]: Her thick black hair cascaded down below her waist.
example[2]: Gallons of water cascaded over the side of the bath.
definition[3]: to pass information or skills to people at a lower level in your organization, or to be passed down in this way
example[3]: This information will be cascaded down to employees through their line managers.
